definition: to relieve a sentry/to change the guard
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)

sentences.english: Palace guards' changing a rites is to be subjected to what visitor likes very much.
sentences.chinese: 禁衛軍的換崗儀式是很受遊人喜愛的。

sentences.english: At noon, you’ll watch the changing of the guard.
sentences.chinese: 中午可以觀賞到衛兵換崗的儀式。

sentences.english: At least 3000 police officials in Chongqing are facing a major job reshuffle.
sentences.chinese: 重慶將有至少3000名警察面臨大換崗。

sentences.english: Evaluate risks carefully before you make a move.
sentences.chinese: 當您準備換崗以前您需要仔細地評估這些風險。

sentences.english: Everyone likes to see the change of the Guards and hopefully see the Queen.
sentences.chinese: 所有人都喜歡看衛兵換崗和期待看到女王。

sentences.english: Do you have the changing of the guard today?
So when the opportunity came for a transfer I took it.
sentences.chinese: 所以我抓住一個調任機會，成功換崗了。

sentences.english: Such an outcome would symbolise the changing of the guard.
sentences.chinese: 這種結果象徵着衛兵換崗。
